physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient presented with cerebral mass. Excision yielded an abscess with Candida albicans. Serial CSF analyses revealed ongoing inflammation (pleocytosis and elevated protein) and recurrent isolation of C. albicans.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After initiation of GM-CSF therapy, subjective improvement was noted within 6 days. Objectively, there was sustained sterility of CSF and normalization of CSF pleocytosis, protein, and glucose concentration for the first time in over a decade. Symptoms worsened and CSF parameters declined upon discontinuation of GM-CSF, while symptoms improved and parameters normalized upon reinstitution of therapy.
